result.execSummary:
The defendant Maxwell S McDonald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay 'buy money' reimbursement amount of $590( joint and several with Mitchell Barron)

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to undergo random urinalyses (at least 1 time per month for first 3 months)
--to continue employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--no contact with Mitchell Barron or Nicholas Herrmann
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent 

The Court grants Mr. McDonald the opportunity to request expungement upon successful completion of Probation.

Arresting Agency:  Whitewater PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
--to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges,on each count, concurrent,  to commence on May 8, 2015 at  7:00 pm.

 Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

records.addlTxt: Huber Law/Work Release Notification
criminal case settlement
Amended

Case called at 10:12am [mo]
Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Maxwell S McDonald in court with attorney Molly Petrea Fellenz.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ files an Amended Information 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Amended Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made by Mr. McDonald 

On Amended Counts #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges,on each count, concurrent,  to commence on May 8, 2015 at  7:00 pm.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to undergo random urinalyses (at least 1 time per month for first 3 months)
--to continue employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--no contact with Mitchell Barron or Nicholas Herrmann
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent 
--On Count #1 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay 'buy money' reimbursement amount of $590( joint and several with Mitchell Barron)

The Court grants Mr. McDonald the opportunity to request expungement upon successful completion of Probation.

Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess: 10:36am
For continuance is granted
Status conference on April 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Proposed stip and order for continuance
States demand w/cover letter
Status conference on March 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2015 at 01:20 pm.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 2:56pm[MO]
Defendant Maxwell S McDonald in court with Attorney Molly Petrea Fellenz.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. McDonald waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

The Court reminds Mr. McDonald that his bond and its conditions remain in effect for the duration of the case. 
Recess:2:59pm
